page.title: 13HISTORICAL WICKWAR
page.content: Historically WICKWAR is derived from the "WICKEN"of the DE LA WARRE family.The EARL of DUCIE is now theLORD of the MANOR. WICKWAR was mentioned in the DOMESDAY book, the first edition of course! The town has not grown as some local towns have.Nowadays there are approximately 1,000+ inhabitants.A recently built new private housing estate of some 50 houses are the first private houses built in number for many years.A number of council houses were built in the 1960's. The school numbers have remained about the same,between70--80 for many years,while other areas have a drop in numbers,often ending in school closure.Recent planning development means that Wickwar is likely to grow as there has been permission given to build on 17.4 acres of land.
